title: Regional, not global, processes led to huge Martian floods
text:
Martian lakes, seas formed by emerging underground aquifers October 19, 2010

Area on Mars reveals a surface modified by water over much of planet's history July 8, 2014

In its early years, planet Mars comprised large volumes of groundwater, which regularly flowed to the surface. Building our own copy of Mars in the laboratory was hard work. We had to shift 15 tonnes of sand to create a swimming-pool-sized model of the red planet. Tides flowing in a subsurface ocean of molten rock, or magma, could explain why Jupiter's moon Io appears to have its volcanoes in the "wrong" place.
